description.value:
What’s difficult to learn through teaching or reading, is that as your experience grows, sometimes the best casts come from more than just impeccable pronunciation and precision wrist flicks. With a bit of emotion, instinct, and brute forcing, you’ve found the theoretical limits of spells to be more flexible than they appear.

When you cast a spell, you have access to additional charge options depending on its spell components.

If the spell has a Somatic component, you can choose to meet that component with at least two hands to gain access to the following charge options:

  • 1 Mana: Increase one of the spell’s damage amounts by either 2d6 or 1d12.
  • 1 Mana: Extend the range of a touch spell by 5ft.
  • X Mana: Target two creatures within 5ft of each other instead of one if it is a single-target spell. The charge cost is equal to half of the spell’s mana cost.

If the spell has a Verbal component, you can choose to meet that component by shouting its incantation to gain access to the following charge options:

  • 1 Mana: Extend the range of a non-touch spell by 15ft.
  • 2 Mana: Increase the spell save DC by 2.
  • 2 Mana: Expand the spell’s areas of effect, increasing the dimensions of each shape by 5ft.

If the spell has a Material component that you are meeting using a spellcasting focus, but you supply the spell with material components anyway, then you gain access to the following charge option:

  • 0 Mana: Every listed material component is consumed by the casting. As a result, reduce the casting time of the spell: 
    • If the casting time is greater than 1 minute, reduce it by 1 minute.
    • If the casting time is 1 minute or less but greater than an Action, cast it as an Action.
    • If the casting time is an Action, cast it as a Minor Action.
    • If the casting time is a Minor Action, cast it as a Reaction.
  • X Mana: If the casting time is 1 hour or more, reduce the casting time by half. The mana cost is equal to each hour removed from the spell, minimum of 1.

If the spell has either a Verbal or Somatic component, you gain access to the following charge option:

  • 1 Mana: The spell no longer requires a Verbal component. However, spells that amplify a verbal component still require your voice.
  • 1 Mana: The spell no longer requires a Somatic component. Spells with a range of touch can be applied to creatures within 5ft without having to touch them.
